goal:
The MTA is committed to the advancement, shaping and serving of science. Keeping the criteria of excellence in the forefront, the main responsibilities of the Academy, as the prime representative of Hungarian science, are to support and represent various scientific fields, and to distribute scientific results. MTA contributes not only to the organisation of scientific research in Hungary, but it also aims to forge closer links between Hungarian and international research.
Pursuant to Section 1 (1) of the Act XL of 1994 on the MTA, „[t]he Hungarian Academy of Sciences (hereinafter: "the Academy") shall be an independent public-law association based on the principle of self-government and functioning as a legal person. As such it shall perform nationwide public responsibilities related to the pursuit, support, and representation of science.”
According to Section 3 (1) of the same Act, „[i]t shall be the public duty of the Academy
(a) to support the pursuit of sciences, scientific research and the publication of scientific books and journals;
(b) to maintain, regulate, and efficiently operate a professional research network funded by the government budget for the pursuit of scientific research;
(c) to operate a system of scientific qualification granting the following titles: Doctor of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences (hereinafter: “Doctor of HAS”), and Corresponding Member or Full Member of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences. The award of titles shall be governed by rules and regulations to be laid down by the Academy;
(d) to evaluate regularly the results and trends of scientific research at home and abroad, and also to formulate relevant proposals;
(e) when asked by Parliament or Government, to formulate its professional judgment on issues within its competence, i. e. issues mainly of science, education, society, the environment and the economy;
(f) to promote the development of the Hungarian language and the pursuit of science and scholarship in Hungarian;
(g) to safeguard the professional integrity of the scientific community, the freedom of scientific research and the freedom of expression of scientific opinion;
(h) to maintain relations and conclude agreements with scientific institutions and organisations established in Hungary or in other countries, as well as international scientific institutions and organisations, especially academies, institutions of higher education, and scientific organisations of the EU;
(i) to maintain relations with scholars and scientists living abroad but working in fields related to Hungary or doing their research work in Hungarian, and to support Hungarian science and scholarship pursued beyond Hungary’s frontiers;
(j) to organise scientific programs and conferences, and to publish competitive calls for proposals;
(k) to promote and assist the social and economic application of the results of scientific research;
(l) on the basis of agreements that may be concluded with institutions of higher education and public libraries or museums, to maintain scientific research units at such institutions and to participate in undergraduate education and doctoral education taking place at institutions of higher education;
(m) to enhance the continuous renewal of the research community by means of a system of grants to be financed from a special heading in the Academy’s budget; whether from its own resources or on the basis of a unilateral declaration of undertaking for a public purpose, the Academy may endow grants or prizes or may offer a reward for researchers of outstanding promise for a limited period; the conditions and details of such endowments and rewards shall be laid down in a regulation by the Academy;
(n) to establish scientific sections, which shall be the basic units of scientific professional autonomy, and to form other bodies (e. g. scientific committees, regional committees, etc.) in a manner set by the Statutes.”
